TextView.android:text: Registration of deceased person, on time registration (0-30 days from date of death) & delayed registration 31 days & above from date of death
- Relatives of the deceased\n- Guardian of the deceased
2. Notification Record issued by RHM/Nurse (1 original copy)
3. If murder, police report (1 original copy)
5. Affidavit of Delayed Registration of death
1.1. Receive\n\n1.2. Process, type the death certificate
2. Pay to the Municipal Treasurer’s Office (If delayed only)
₱150.00\n(Late Registration 2 months & above after date of death)
2.2. Instruct customer for signaturee:\n*Municipal Health Officer\n*Embalmer (if embalm)
3. Review the accomplished form and sign the item for informant.
3.1. Instruct customer to submit the document after signatures
4. Proceed to Municipal Health Office and embalmer for signature
4.1. Assignment of Registry No. and type the name of Receiving Officer
5. Present the OR to the Receiving Clerk

5.1. Accept OR

5.2. Advice the customer to come back after 10 days posting, & post “Notice”

5.3. After 10 days, receiving clerk, affix registry number

5.4. Seal 

5.5. Present accomplished COD to the MCR/Assistant for review and signature

5.6. Segregate and file
6. Submit the accomplished Certificate of Death
8. After 10 days, customer get the Accomplished Certificate of Death(COD)
9. Accomplish Client Satisfactory Survey (CSS) and drop it in the feedback box
9.1. Request Client to Accomplish Client Satisfactory Survey (CSS) form in the feedback box
